reviewText: Fun hoary pre-code supernatural undertoned melodrama with nice work by Mischa Auer and Mae Busch in particular.  Not a bad print-- not a great one, either, but I've seen worse of this title.  A good choice for those who like to find oddball pre-code tales.  Progressive Pictures 1933 in the public domain available from Alpha Video.

First a word about DVD-Rs-- Often, these transfers are of a quality similar to multi-film budget brands. The movies themselves are unrestored and rarely pristine yet still watchable (unless there's an inordinate number of repaired breaks). Extras are non-existent and inclusion of artwork or liner notes varies by manufacturer. These niche companies can provide a valuable outlet for antique movies unavailable anywhere else. . SUCKER MONEY is a Progressive Pictures programmer filmed at Republic Studios. Director Dorothy Davenport was also Mrs. Wallace Reid. Primarily an actress between 1910 and '34, Miss Davenport helmed a total of five movies, all with a "victim" theme: HUMAN WRECKAGE (1923), LINDA (1929), this one, THE ROAD TO RUIN (1934) and THE WOMAN CONDEMNED (1934). SYNOPSIS-- Reporter Jimmy Reeves is sent undercover in an attempt to expose a group of con artists whose leader, a be-turbaned hypnotist named Swami Yomurda, tugs at his victims' heartstrings with a variety of tricks, thus loosening their pursestrings. Yormuda's upfront accomplice is a mesmerized woman identified as Princess Karami. While she communes with the great beyond, films are projected on a black screen or actors located in the basement play out scenarios that also appear on this "magic window." Once visitors see their loved ones (that is, the actors) are in trouble, they're desperate to help them and ripe to be scammed. One of these targets is banker John Walton. His daughter Claire is hypnotized as preparation for conning her father out of a small fortune. Jimmy hires on as a player in Yormuda's troupe. The Swami soon learns he's a double-crosser and holds him prisoner. Jimmy's only ally is Mame, an actress with a drinking problem who's willing to help him. She gets word to his boss that Jimmy's in danger but later pays dearly for this kind deed, and now that the police have been alerted, Claire and Jimmy may meet a fate similar to Mame's. Parenthetical number preceding title is a 1 to 10 imdb viewer poll rating. (5.1) Sucker Money (1933) - Mischa Auer/Phyllis Barrington/Earl McCarthy/Ralph Lewis/Fletcher Norton/Mae Busch/Mona Lisa/Al Bridge

ALPHA VIDEO offers bargain priced, often hard-to-find vintage movies that are ideal for those willing to skip DVD extras. Their transfers show no evidence of restoration, so quality varies from one title to the next, with "fair to good" being the average. .
